node.title: Government sets aside $572m for Whangārei Hospital
node.description: The government has ringfenced $572 million for a Whangārei Hospital redevelopment.
node.content:
["The government has ringfenced $572 million for a Whangārei Hospital redevelopment.", "", "
Whangārei Hospital. Photo: RNZ / Sam Olley
", "The hospital does not meet building standards or requirements for clinical best practice and the Northland District Health Board has been reporting "decay and dilapidation" to the government for years.", "Redevelopment talks began in 2015, but Te Tai Tokerau's population has boomed since the original designs were submitted.", "Since 2017, the DHB has told the government that overall demand for ED, intensive care, inpatient beds, and theatre services has surpassed capacity - and Northland's medical and surgical needs have been "unprecedented".", "Last year RNZ revealed raw sewage was leaking down the inside of walls of the hospital's medical wing.", "The piping is taking two years to fix, at a cost of $2.8m, because it is surrounded by asbestos.", "Last year, Health Minister Andrew Little said the hospital was one of "a number" of priority redevelopments needed.", "In a statement this morning, his office said the cost of the Northland DHB's redevelopment business case, Project Pihi Kaha, was originally put at $572m.", "The minister confirmed the government had ringfenced that amount, "subject to the business case".", "He expects this latest version to be submitted by mid-2022.", "Northland DHB chief executive Dr Nick Chamberlain was aware money had been set aside for the hospital, and he believed it would be distributed across this year's budget and next year's.", ""We're making good progress with the business case and have had an independent review of it, which is a standard process. [We've] worked with our clinicians on the detail of that and are planning to submit the business case to the April Capital Investment Committee meeting."", "He had previously anticipated funding would be announced in last year's budget."]
